newsitem.title: UK: LME copper still lower in evening trade.
newsitem.headline: LME copper still lower in evening trade.

text.p: Copper prices remained lower during London Metal Exchange evening inter-office business.
Three months delivery was indicated at $2,365/$2,370 at 1800 GMT. This compared with last afternoon business at $2,373, a hefty $64 loss from Tuesday's kerb close.
Earlier in the day, it hit a seven-week low of $2,355. Traders attributed copper's latest slide to another wave of speculative selling, sell-stops, and option-related sales.

"Technical copper remains vulnerable to further downward pressure, though having already fallen significantly, a period of consolidation may be on the cards," broker Rudolf Wolff said in an evening report.
Zinc and aluminium also extended afternoon losses with last evening business around $1,388/$1,393 and $1,564/$1,566 respectively.
